title: Professional Portfolio
description_full: I can imagine every web developer feels the need to create a personal website.

When I began to plan for mine, I knew I wanted to have the site showcase many types of information in an easy-to-follow, but interesting manner.  The categories and styles I settled upon are the ones you see here.

title: Rock Paper Scissors
description_short: A digital rendition of a childhood game.
description_full: My guess as to why Rock Paper Scissors was so popular when I was a child what that it was simple to learn, and exciting!  Yelling and throwing your hands around is always a good time.
This implementation of RPS as a web game strives to capture all of the simplicity, and give a nod to the excitement through the rendering of images with the play chosen game outcomes.
The game can be played by clicking on the left side selections on the live site, and unit and feature tests can be run with a local build as described in the Github documentation.

title: Kibbles 'n Bites
description_short: Order the best snacks and meals, for your pets!

title: Address Book
description_short: A sleek UI to store contacts.
description_full: The Address Book application focuses on implementing styles from a content delivery network and using session storage in the browser to mimic CRUD methods usually implemented with an api, but with a front-end-only solution.
Please review the documentation in the github repository for a demonstration flow of the application on the live site and the process to establish a local build to run feature tests.
